intro: Tanacetum meyerianum, commonly known as Meyer's tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in moist meadows, stream sides, and woodland edges. Due to its aromatic properties, it has been used historically in herbal medicine and as a natural insect repellent.
